revised_title: Edmund Halley's Method for Finding Longitude at Sea
tldr: Dr. Edmund Halley proposes a method for finding longitude at sea using lunar observations and accurate timekeeping. He shares his experience and progress in developing this method, which involves a series of accurate observations of the Moon taken at the Royal Observatory at Greenwich. Halley's method aims to improve the accuracy of determining longitude at sea, which was a significant challenge for sailors during that time.
